title: Chapter 1: The Farm - Stage 1
description: Our farmhand receives an unexpected royal summons.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The sun dipped low over the golden fields, casting long shadows across rows of wheat. A young farmhand named Caelan stood at the edge of the family land, wiping sweat from their brow, unaware that fate was already galloping toward them.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From the dirt path beyond the scarecrow-strewn fence came a rider clad in emerald and silver, the royal colors of King Alaric's court. The rider dismounted, bearing a scroll bound with wax and bearing the King's seal.

story.name: Stranger
story.lines: You are Caelan of the West Vale?

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: I am

story.name: Stranger
story.lines: I have a message for you from the King.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The royal messenger hands you a scroll sealed with wax.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The scroll trembles in your hands as you break the seal. “Your blood bears the mark of the gods,” it read. “Destiny calls you to rescue the Princess from the evil Lich King.”

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The next morning, Caelan gathered together a group of friends and headed out from the farm. The journey would span forests thick with wolves, mountains haunted by spirits, and deserts scorched by fire. But the message was clear-they were the last descendant of the Old Gods, and the world once again needed their power.

title: Chapter 1: The Farm - Stage 2
description: Caelan and friends leave the familiar fields behind as rumors of prowling beasts spread.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: As the village winds faded behind them, Caelan glanced back one final time at the only home they had ever known. In the silence of departure, the fields seemed to whisper of a past now out of reach.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: You sure about this? Leaving everything behind for a dream in a letter?

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: It's not just a dream. It's a call. If we don't go, who will?

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The road ahead twisted through wind-swept pastures and overgrown trails. But something was wrong. The animals were uneasy, and old farmers spoke of shadows stealing livestock under moonlight.

title: Chapter 1: The Farm - Stage 3
description: An ambush in the barley fields threatens to end the journey before it begins.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The group took a shortcut through a barley field, hoping to avoid the main road. The air was thick with the scent of grain and unease.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: Shh... did you hear that? Rustling to the north.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Before they could react, shadows burst from the crop. Gnolls and goblins - too many for mere coincidence.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This wasn't random. Someone sent them. Hold the line!

title: Chapter 1: The Farm - Stage 4
description: At the edge of the farmland, ancient stone ruins whisper secrets of Caelan's heritage.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: They reached a crumbling ruin where the farm met the wild woods. Vines choked broken stone etched with unfamiliar runes.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: These stones are... older than the Kingdom. Look-this symbol. The same as on your scroll, Caelan.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: As the sun set, a chill swept in. The ruins trembled. From the shadows came creatures twisted by old magic-guardians of something long forgotten.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: They're not here by chance. The Old Gods... left warnings.

title: Chapter 1: The Farm - Stage 5
description: A hobgoblin warlord blocks the final gate out of the farmland. A first true test of steel and spirit.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: At the boundary fence where the farm met the woods, a crude palisade had been raised. Smoke rose from campfires. A warband had made camp.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: We can't go around. This is their checkpoint. We go through-or turn back.

story.name: Warlord Brakka
story.lines: No one leaves the vale without my mark. And my mark... is death.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The hobgoblin known as Brakka was a brute even among his kind. Flanked by goblins and gnolls, he raised a warhammer carved with bones. The first true battle had begun.

title: Chapter 2: The Woods - Stage 1
description: The group steps into the Witherwood, where the air is heavy with enchantment and the trees whisper ancient curses.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The moment their feet crossed the threshold into the Witherwood, the air thickened. Light seemed to dim, though the sky remained clear.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The trees here are wrong. I can feel something watching... everywhere.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This is where the map goes silent. We'll need to trust our instincts now.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Half-seen shadows flickered in the distance, and paths twisted when no one was looking. This was no ordinary forest.

title: Chapter 2: The Woods - Stage 2
description: An eerie clearing reveals a forgotten shrine to a goddess of dusk. The ground is littered with bones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: In a quiet clearing, moss-covered stones formed a crude circle. At the center: a broken statue, half-buried and weeping dark sap.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Is this... a shrine? But to what?

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The Lady of Dusk. My grandmother used to whisper prayers to her when lightning storms came.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Bones surrounded the altar-animal, goblin, human. Something still claimed tribute here.

title: Chapter 2: The Woods - Stage 3
description: The woods turn to bog as mists rise and illusions test the group's resolve.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The path descended into mist-covered bogland. Sounds were muffled, shapes distorted. Every step threatened to drag them under.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Did you see that? A woman in red just beyond those trees. Then-gone.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: I saw my mother. She died five winters ago. That wasn't real, was it?

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The forest here didn't just deceive the eyes-it hunted the mind. Phantasms rose from the fog, echoing the party's darkest memories.

title: Chapter 2: The Woods - Stage 4
description: They reach the heart of the Witherwood: a colossal tree grown around a ruin. Something stirs beneath the roots.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: A giant oak loomed, wider than a cottage and tall as a keep. Its roots had grown through broken stone steps and shattered arches.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: These ruins are elven. Old elven. Before the Sundering.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Do you feel that hum? Like... something breathing. Beneath us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Suddenly, rot burst from the roots-animated husks of long-dead forest guardians, corrupted by centuries of decay.

title: Chapter 2: The Woods - Stage 5
description: A corrupted forest spirit reveals itself, guarding the only safe path out of the Witherwood.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: In the thickest part of the forest, the fog parted around a perfect circle of mushrooms and thorns. In the center hovered a being once divine-now decayed.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: That... was a forest guardian. But something's poisoned it.

story.name: Corrupted Sylvana
story.lines: You do not belong here, mortals. This realm is mine again. You will not leave with your minds... or your lives.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This spirit guards the threshold. If we fall here, the forest keeps us. Stand firm!

title: Chapter 3: The Hills - Stage 1
description: Leaving the forest behind, the party climbs into the rugged highlands. The wind howls with voices that don't belong to the living.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: With the cursed forest behind them, Caelan's party entered a land of cold stone and wide skies. The hills rolled like waves - each peak hiding secrets.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The wind speaks in the old tongue... I don't like it.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: These hills were once battlefields. The dead remember.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The path ahead forked between cairns marked by broken blades. None felt welcome.

title: Chapter 3: The Hills - Stage 2
description: They stumble upon a grave field where ancient warriors once clashed. The dead do not rest easily here.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: An eerie hush fell over a field of ancient burial cairns. Dozens of them, each crowned with rusted helms and blackened spears.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: These are war graves... this was a massacre site.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Then tread lightly. Disturb nothing. Take only our memories, and-

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: A spectral horn blew in the distance. The cairns began to shift.

title: Chapter 3: The Hills - Stage 3
description: A narrow gorge offers shelter from the wind - and the perfect place for an ambush.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The wind died down as they descended into a rocky gorge. Walls rose steep on either side, and their footsteps echoed too loudly.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: I don't like this. Nowhere to run. Nowhere to flank.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: It's too quiet. Something's wrong-

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Raiders burst from the shadows, painted in blood and ash, blades drawn. They didn't want coin. They wanted a kill.

title: Chapter 3: The Hills - Stage 4
description: They find a crumbling stone wall - the remnants of a long-fallen kingdom. Something stirs behind the stones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Massive blocks of stone jutted from the hillside - the skeletal remains of a forgotten citadel. Moss crept through runes carved in a dead language.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: These aren't just ruins. This was a fortress... guarding something.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The earth here is cursed. I feel pain... grief... rage trapped under the stones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From beneath the wall, armored skeletons rose - their eyes glowing with hate centuries old.

title: Chapter 3: The Hills - Stage 5
description: A brutal storm crashes through the hills - and with it comes a legendary warrior long believed to be dead.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Black clouds rolled in unnaturally fast. Lightning struck the hills, and with each flash, a ghostly figure stood atop a stone mound - closer with every strike.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: That's no living man. That's the Stormbound General. He died a hundred years ago.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Then why is he drawing his blade now?

story.name: Stormbound General
story.lines: I fell with honor... but no peace. You trespass upon my tomb, and now you'll lie beside me.

title: Chapter 4: The Forgotten Road - Stage 1
description: The remnants of an imperial road stretch before the party - shattered stone lined with dead trees and forgotten bones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: What once was a mighty road of trade and glory now lay cracked and overgrown. Roots burst through stone like the earth reclaiming its due.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This road led to the capital of the old empire. Nothing's traveled it in years.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: Nothing living, maybe. But plenty of things still watch from the ruins.

title: Chapter 4: The Forgotten Road - Stage 2
description: A collapsed bridge spans a dry riverbed. Crossing it draws the attention of something that does not belong in the mortal world.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The bridge groaned under their weight, even though much of it had long since fallen. Shadows moved below... though no water flowed.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: There's... something below us. It sees us.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: We move fast, or we fall with the stones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The dead beneath the bridge rose to meet them - still shackled to the stone in undeath.

title: Chapter 4: The Forgotten Road - Stage 3
description: The road passes through a dead village. Doors hang open, but nothing moves. That is, until night falls.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The village had no name, only memories. Homes stood hollowed by fire and time. Yet not a single corpse remained.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: This wasn't abandoned. It was purged.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: There's magic here. I feel a ritual burned into the stones.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: As night fell, glowing eyes filled the windows. The village's former residents had never left.

title: Chapter 4: The Forgotten Road - Stage 4
description: Statues of ancient emperors line the road - each shattered, each face defaced. One remains intact... and it breathes.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Headless statues watched from the roadside. Long ago, they glorified forgotten rulers - now they stood like silent mourners.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: These weren't toppled by war. This was deliberate. A cleansing of history.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: One still stands... and it's watching us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The last statue opened its stone eyes and stepped from its pedestal, sword raised in eternal defense.

title: Chapter 4: The Forgotten Road - Stage 5
description: The road ends at a broken temple, half-swallowed by the earth. Inside, a heretic prince still guards the old empire's final secret.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The path curved into a wide crater where a sunken temple lay beneath tangled roots and cracked stone. It whispered of betrayal.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This temple was dedicated to the sun... but something dark has claimed it now.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Someone's inside. I feel it. He's been waiting.

story.name: Heretic Prince
story.lines: The empire fell, and I remain. I am its last son - its executioner. You will not pass.

title: Chapter 5: The Wastelands - Stage 1
description: The fertile earth gives way to blackened dust and skeletal trees. The wind tastes of ash. The Wastelands begin.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The sky dimmed as if choked by unseen smoke. The Wastelands stretched before them - a dead land where nothing thrived.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This place was razed in the First War. The ground never recovered.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: Magic clings here, but it's wrong. Poisoned. Every step burns.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The dust stirred... and the cursed remnants of the war stirred with it.

title: Chapter 5: The Wastelands - Stage 2
description: A deep fissure cuts across the land. Crossing it requires passing over a brittle, bone-laced bridge watched by unseen eyes.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The ground split like a scar across the world. A narrow bridge of bone and ash spanned the chasm, creaking with every step.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: That's not stone holding that together. That's skulls... and something's watching us from below.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From the depths of the fissure, the dead began to crawl forth, unwilling to let them pass.

title: Chapter 5: The Wastelands - Stage 3
description: An oasis appears amidst the ruin, impossibly green. But the water is black and the trees whisper lies.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: In the heart of the blight, green shimmered. Trees, flowers, water - untouched. But the smell was wrong. Too sweet. Too still.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: Illusion. No... worse. It's real, but corrupted. Something is feeding on us.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: We burn it down, or it consumes us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The trees screamed as they burned. And from the dark water came those who had drunk the poison... and changed.

title: Chapter 5: The Wastelands - Stage 4
description: A ruined watchtower offers brief shelter. Inside, forgotten soldiers still stand guard - unaware they died long ago.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The tower leaned, held together by spite and memory. Banners of a fallen kingdom fluttered in the dead air.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This was a border post. These men defended the realm once...

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The sound of armor creaked from within. Dust-covered soldiers turned hollow eyes toward the intruders - blades raised.

title: Chapter 5: The Wastelands - Stage 5
description: At the edge of the world rises the Black Spire, a monument of bone and hatred. Its guardian has stood for centuries - and never once fallen.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The Black Spire tore at the sky, made of fused bones and cursed stone. The wind carried screams that never ceased.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This is a waygate. It leads deeper. The Lich King's true domain lies beyond.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: And something's guarding it. I can hear its breath. Still alive after all these years?

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: A knight clad in tarnished obsidian plate emerged. His oath unbroken. His soul bound. He would not let them pass.

title: Chapter 6: The Bleeding Crags - Stage 1
description: The ground turns jagged, veins of red stone pulsing like a heartbeat beneath the earth. You've entered the Bleeding Crags.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The cliffs bled. Not metaphorically - red ichor oozed from cracks in the rock. The ground pulsed like something alive... or dying.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This place was a temple once. Now it's a wound - kept open by ritual and sacrifice.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: I don't care what gods they served. We close this wound.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The stone responded - birthing guardians made of blood and rage.

title: Chapter 6: The Bleeding Crags - Stage 2
description: An ancient shrine stands defiled - once a place of healing, now echoing with the cries of blood offerings.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Cracked statues and broken altars lined the shrine, their eyes weeping rust. The air was thick with pain.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: The rocks are screaming. You hear that? They're not just cursed - they remember.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: They made pacts here... old ones. And someone's keeping them alive.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The blood priests emerged, masked in flesh, knives singing with hunger.

title: Chapter 6: The Bleeding Crags - Stage 3
description: The path narrows to knife-edged ledges, where the wind howls with lost voices and skeletal remains stir underfoot.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Bones littered the narrow trail, pressed into the rock as though swallowed by the mountain. Something moved beneath the surface.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: These weren't warriors. They were sacrifices. Executed to feed the stone.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The mountain heaved. From cracks in the path, twisted remnants clawed their way out - failed offerings that still hungered.

title: Chapter 6: The Bleeding Crags - Stage 4
description: A massive pit glows with crimson runes. Echoes of chants and screams spill from below. A ritual is underway.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Deep within the Crags, the ritual pit boiled with blood and fire. Runes danced across the walls, old magic bound in pain.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: They're calling something. If we let it finish, the Wastelands will spread.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: Then we crash the ceremony.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Chanting stopped. The pit hissed. And from its heart rose creatures formed from ritual sacrifice itself.

title: Chapter 6: The Bleeding Crags - Stage 5
description: At the peak lies the Throne of Veins - a grotesque altar where the Blood Queen waits. She bleeds, and the world bleeds with her.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: A monstrous throne sculpted from veins, flesh, and bone loomed before them. Upon it sat the Blood Queen - mother of rituals, priestess of decay.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: She's not mortal. Not anymore. Her magic twists life itself.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Then we cut her from the mountain and watch it bleed out.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The Blood Queen rose, bleeding from every pore. The mountain shuddered - her children stirred - and battle was joined.

title: Chapter 7: The Glass Wastes - Stage 1
description: Sand becomes glass underfoot. Shards of reality reflect not just light, but memory. The Glass Wastes begin.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The dunes shimmered like broken mirrors. The wind didn't howl - it whispered voices from other times.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: This place was destroyed by magic. Nothing here is stable - not even time.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: I see echoes of people who never lived. They're walking... beside us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Shards rose into shapes, mimicking warriors of the past - crystalized memories turned hostile.

title: Chapter 7: The Glass Wastes - Stage 2
description: A once-great temple lies splintered in the sands - fragments of its time scattered across reality.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The temple had no center. Its pieces floated, suspended in fractured time. Every step was a gamble against entropy.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: I just saw myself die. Three steps ahead. Don't ask.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: These distortions... they're feeding something. A being that lives between seconds.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Mirage guardians stepped from frozen echoes - glass helms, sandsteel blades, and no shadows beneath them.

title: Chapter 7: The Glass Wastes - Stage 3
description: The canyon walls pulse with prismatic light, refracting moments you haven't lived. Something is watching through the shards.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Each canyon wall held glimpses of other paths - victories, failures, lives unlived. A thousand possibilities, none real.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: If I hesitate... I become one of them. A reflection. A ghost of a choice I didn't make.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The echoes are sentient. Some... remember being real.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Time phantoms erupted from the canyon - each a distorted version of something you once were... or might become.

title: Chapter 7: The Glass Wastes - Stage 4
description: Beneath a shifting dune lies a city trapped in a time loop. It restarts every hour, unaware of its own doom.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The sunken city breathed in loops. Every hour, it collapsed - and rose again. Citizens screamed, rebuilt, forgot. Endlessly.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: They're not alive. But they don't know that.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: A Chronarch is buried here. Its anchor holds this nightmare together. Break it - or be caught in the loop forever.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The loop resisted - unleashing its guardians made of frozen moments and burning sand.

title: Chapter 7: The Glass Wastes - Stage 5
description: In the heart of the Wastes rises a crystalline tower. At its peak, the Chronarch awaits - master of fractured time.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The tower shimmered out of sync with the world. Inside, each floor was a different year. Reality frayed at the edges.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: He's not bound by time. He *is* time. Or what's left of it.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Then we unmake the clock. Let the Wastes collapse behind us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The Chronarch descended - a being of glass and starlight. With every blow, the world cracked a little more.

title: Chapter 8: The Silent Deep - Stage 1
description: The sky vanishes. You descend into the earth's breathless core, past roots older than nations and echoes older than time.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The light thinned, the air thickened. What began as a cave became a wound in the world - leading only down.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: There's no wind... no life. Even magic feels muted.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This isn't a cave. It's a grave for things too dangerous to burn or bury.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Movement. Shadows writhing on the walls - not from your torchlight. Something else moves here, unseen.

title: Chapter 8: The Silent Deep - Stage 2
description: A forest of bioluminescent fungi pulses with sickly light. It breathes. And it's watching.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The chamber pulsed like a lung. Spores hung thick in the air. The ground squelched underfoot.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: These spores... they think. They remember. They're trying to *speak* to me.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: Then stop listening. We don't need another parasite in our heads.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From beneath the glowing stalks, creatures rose - part man, part fungus, all wrong.

title: Chapter 8: The Silent Deep - Stage 3
description: A river of black water flows through a tomb of bones. The ferry waits - but the price is not coin.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The river hissed, refusing to reflect anything real. The ferry awaited - its pilot eyeless, mouthless, timeless.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: He wants... memories. Yours. Mine. Whoever rides forgets who they were.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: Then we fight the river. We *become* the price.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Something old stirred beneath the water - guardians of memory, protectors of the toll.

title: Chapter 8: The Silent Deep - Stage 4
description: Doors sealed with runes older than empires creak open. Inside - the lost knowledge of ancient gods, and the things that guard it.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The vaults hissed open like lungs exhaling dust. Each chamber held a truth too heavy for sane minds.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This is where the old gods buried their shame.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: These guards aren't beasts. They're ideas... made flesh.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Concepts clawed into being: guilt, hunger, silence, regret. And they *hated* the living.

title: Chapter 8: The Silent Deep - Stage 5
description: At the deepest point lies a throne of black stone - and the Watcher Below, an ancient horror sealed in dreamless sleep.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: No footsteps echoed here. Sound died before it reached your ears. And in the center of nothing... it slept.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The Watcher... it doesn't dream. It waits. And it *knows* we're here.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: We end this now. Before it remembers how to wake up.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The Watcher rose, bones of obsidian and eyes of void. Its scream birthed silence.

title: Chapter 9: The Blighted Reach - Stage 1
description: You emerge into a broken world. The sky bleeds violet, and the ground cracks with every step. Life has fled - or become something worse.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The land here screams in silence. Trees twist into gallows. Rivers run backward. Nothing is as it should be.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This is where the Lich King's shadow first touched the world. Everything it touched died - and stayed.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: No... not died. *Changed*. This place remembers pain.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From the hollowed earth, blighted forms crawl, pulled by strings of forgotten sorrow.

title: Chapter 9: The Blighted Reach - Stage 2
description: Once a city, now a graveyard. The spirits here wear the faces of your loved ones - and they want you to stay.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Empty houses stared back at you, windows like dead eyes. The streets whispered old names... yours among them.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: I see... my brother. But he died years ago. This is a trap.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: They're echoes - stolen from us. The Lich King uses our grief against us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Phantoms emerged, each one a twisted memory, fighting not to destroy you - but to make you *forget* yourself.

title: Chapter 9: The Blighted Reach - Stage 3
description: A forest petrified mid-scream. Branches like claws. Roots like veins. And things that hunt without eyes.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The trees grew in unnatural shapes, each one grasping at the sky that had long since turned away.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: This place doesn't want us dead. It wants us *twisted*. Like them.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: The forest watches. Every step we take becomes harder. The roots... they feed on our doubt.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: With a sound like tearing skin, the forest let loose its guardians - beasts carved from rot and sorrow.

title: Chapter 9: The Blighted Reach - Stage 4
description: A holy site, long defiled. Black flames flicker where once stood candles of prayer. Something still lingers within the sanctum.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The shrine stank of old blood and rotting faith. Its idols wept tar. The stones themselves recoiled from your presence.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: This was sacred once. The corruption runs deepest where the light once burned brightest.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: A guardian remains... not loyal, not alive - but bound.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: A corrupted seraph stepped forward - wings burned away, voice broken by countless betrayals. It would not let you pass.

title: Chapter 9: The Blighted Reach - Stage 5
description: At the center of the Blight lies the Heartroot, pulsing with stolen souls. Its guardian: a creature birthed of the Lich King's first sin.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: You came upon a vast open pit - at its center, the Heartroot pulsed, each throb leaking black mist into the skies.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: That's no natural heart... it's a prison for thousands of souls. And it's *awake*.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: The Guardian knows we're here. It was made to stop us - and it won't stop bleeding until we do.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From within the roots, something massive stirred - not beast, not god, but something far worse: a mistake made manifest.

title: Chapter 10: The Throne of Ash - Stage 1
description: At the edge of the broken world stands a gate forged from bone and sorrow. It only opens for those who carry both.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The Ashen Gate loomed like a wound torn in the sky. Glyphs bled fire. Screams echoed from within.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: Once we cross, there's no turning back. This gate opens *into* death, not out of it.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: Then we bring life into it. Or we leave nothing behind.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: From the gate's shadows, twisted sentinels rose - former heroes, now enslaved to undeath.

title: Chapter 10: The Throne of Ash - Stage 2
description: An endless hall of obsidian mirrors reflects not your form - but your failures. Here, the mind breaks before the body.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Each step echoed a thousand regrets. The mirrors whispered your worst fears back at you... in your own voice.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: They show me when I fled... when I failed. They want me to kneel before I ever see him.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: We all carry shadows. But they do not own us.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Illusions coalesced into deadly forms - figments given hunger by the Lich King's will.

title: Chapter 10: The Throne of Ash - Stage 3
description: Pyramids of skulls, rivers of marrow. The Vault of Bones stores the essence of every soul the Lich King has devoured.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: You passed through corridors built from the dead. Faces frozen in agony stared from the walls.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: He feeds on them... even now. The princess is among them - I can feel her cry out.

story.name: Caelan
story.lines: Then we carve our way through. For her. For all of them.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The dead stirred - not mindless, but *bound*. They begged for release with every strike.

title: Chapter 10: The Throne of Ash - Stage 4
description: Before the throne lies the Crown of Black Flame - a sentient inferno, loyal only to its master.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: Black fire rose in a dome before the final ascent. It laughed without sound, hungry for defiance.

story.name: Garrick
story.lines: That... thing. It's not just fire. It's hatred. A crown forged from his first war.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: We snuff it out - or it becomes *our* crown.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The flames formed into knights of ash and shadow. The Crown would not surrender its place without a final inferno.

title: Chapter 10: The Throne of Ash - Final Battle
description: At last, the Throne. The princess is bound in chains of grief. The Lich King rises, eyes burning with the end of all things.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The throne was carved from the corpses of kings. Upon it sat the Lich King, cloaked in despair, crowned by eternity.

story.name: Lich King
story.lines: You have come far, little lights. But light cannot survive where time has died.

story.name: Elira
story.lines: You fear the light because it remembers who you once were. We will *remind* you.

story.name: Narrator
story.lines: The final battle began - soul against shadow, memory against oblivion. The fate of the world burned between them.
